Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, as long as neighbouring guests are quiet”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: The good: We stayed here at a good price for a reasonably central Paris hotel. The rooms are relatively large for Paris hotels, and include a kitchenette (we didn't cook, but it was nice to be able ea fruit conveniently in the room). The bad: The floors/ceilings are paper thin. One night I woke up hearing the footsteps of the people in the room above, thinking there was someone in our room. Fortunately our neighbours were qiuet, but it is still disconcerting to be able to hear so clearly what is going on in the room above you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chacha1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with three friends- we were lured by its central location and the fact there is a kitchen area. Although the reception area could do with a little updating, the hotel room itself was fantastic. Very modern in look with a large double and then twin beds and a lounge area. The mattresses were the most comfortable any of us had slept on in a hotel and water pressure in the shower was good too. Only complaint would have to be the noise between floors. You could literally hear a pin drop from the room above do we were thankful our neighbours were quiet through the night. Location wise the hotel is ideal. Rue cadet is quibtessentially Parisian with a few very good bakeries, a butcher, Italian deli, fromageries and a green grocer all dotted along it, and the beautiful a la mere de famille chocolate shop is less than five minutes away. Cadet metro is also around five minutes walking distance and takes you to most of the sights of Paris within 10 minutes. A real gem. Take ear plugs and you're sorted.

Reviews.Title: “Very good with the exception of housekeeping and noise from neighbouring rooms”
Reviews.Author: tint7003
Reviews.Content: This property is excellently situated right at the heart of Paris. Rooms are stylishly furnished, large and well appointed. Staff were mostly friendly and I was happy with my stay overall. Unfortunately the designers seem to have given little thought to sound proofing between the rooms and, most seriously, between floors. The floor surfaces in the property are tiled which looks great but the constant scraping of furniture legs and the click-clack of footsteps in the room directly above mine became really annoying. Housekeeping was poor - when I first arrived kitchen dishes were left dirty and two were broken. On the first day the housekeeping person told me that if I didn't give her access to the room by 11am then she was leaving and it would be missed that day (which it was) and on the second day when I did get out earlier the waste bins were left unemptied and the bathroom was not cleaned. That kind of service is not really good enough for the price I paid for the room, although other aspects of my stay were fine.

Reviews.Title: “The warmest welcome to Paris imaginable.”
Reviews.Author: Familyhills
Reviews.Content: After walking straight off a train, into a cab whose driver could not have been more helpful, we discover this gem in Rue Cadet where we were greeted so warmly and kindly by the manager we just knew we were in the right place. We have a small child whose experience here has been forever imprinted on her memory - her first trip to Paris is marked by warm and sincere people. And what a lovely location-so easy to get around and just a maze of fascination and awe. We are already planning our next trip to ease the mourning of the end of this one. Take your kids here, they will love the staff, the location and the basic comfort. All needs met above expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: amaansincairo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a couple in July 2010. We found the hotel to be a great base to explore Paris. The metro station is a short walk away, and it is also a 10-15min walk from Gare de Nord which is great as we arrived at this station using a Eurostar train from London. Service was great from all staff. We were given a larger spacious 4-person room as the smaller rooms were full, this was nice as we had a lot of space to relax in. The kitchen was helpful as there were many local supermarkets and we have a particular diet so did not have to rely on restaurants. Breakfast was adequate enough and the hotel was a welcome base to return to after long days exploring Paris. Overall, I would denifinitely return to this hotel. A tip on exchanging money: don't use the desks in the train station as they offer a very poor rate, there are many small shops on the streets outside the station that offer much better rates e.g. to my memory at the time we were being offered 98c-1euro per £ inside the station, and 1.18-1.20euros per £ outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kapitan007
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family of four. Decent size suite. Nice to have a small kitchen to warm food and prepare sandwiches. Abundant quality cafes, patisseries, greengrocers, wine and cheese shops on the street and the metro a couple of minutes walk away. Commendable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: menapian98
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere that combines location with quality, spaciousness, excellent staff and practical amenities then look no further. Cosy's Cadet - really made our trip to Paris thoroughly enjoyable, The interior is modern, comfortable and spacious. A lovely wide screen TV and DVD player, a cooker with hot plates but unfortunately no oven. Fantastic shower also. Cannot recommend it highly enough. Great value for an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect but..”
Reviews.Author: Mykosher
Reviews.Content: Location perfect Service perfect room size perfect clean perfect staff perfect Parking access is dedicated only if you have high driving skills Rooms size is exactly opposite of parking size..happilly im not a car

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Large Suites, Perfect for a Family City Break.”
Reviews.Author: eccysteve
Reviews.Content: Residence Cosy Cadet is ideal for families visiting Paris. Within walking distance of the Gares du Nord and Est, and adjacent to the Cadet Metro station, the hotel is ideally situation in a quite courtyard on a lively street which bustles with good food and wine shops and local bars and bistros. Many of the main sights of Paris are within easy walking distance, but the underground is very close at hand if walking isnt your thing. The suites, set out in a 'loft' style are impressively large for Paris and offer two bedrooms, bathroom, wc, kitchen and a lounge / dining area. The hotel has free wireless wi-fi. The staff are very friendly, helpful and have good local knowledge. Even , better, the hotel is well priced, for Paris. In my view, its the perfect location for families who want a central city base from which to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Suggsygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend for a long weekend and was a bit sceptical about the place having heard that Paris hotel rooms are quite often very small but the room was big. There was a sofa, a large television and a fridge along with the small, but well stocked with cutlery and plates, kitchen. We could make our own tea and coffee (and keep the milk cold) and didn't have to go out for breakfast. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was pleasant and close to the Metro. It was very very good and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Linda O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cosy's for a week in July. Having arrived straight from the airport, we were able to check-in, even though it was too early. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The room was modern and clean. The kitchenette had everything one needs to prepare a meal. The location was perfect with a metro stop (Cadet) at the end of the street. Rue Cadet has wonderful shops. A laundry is around the corner. We will stay at Cosy's again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, paper thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: breazee
Reviews.Content: This place had outstanding staff, and was very well kept and spacious. If I couldn't hear the cellphone vibrating in the next room, it would have been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CassiCoralville_Iowa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Cosy Cadet and were not sorry about selecting this hotel. We found the desk staff to be friendly and helpful. We were very concerned about going to a country where we did not speak the language, but were soon relieved of that concern when we found the desk staff spoke English. Our room was very large and there was a king-sized bed. It is not a real fancy place, but clean and more than adequate. There was a kitchenette if we would have wanted to use it. The Cosy Cadet offers free internet use, which was something we did not find in some of the other places we stayed. Another very positive feature is that the Cosy Cadet is very close to a metro station. It is in an area where there are several small stores and restaurants. We had a very positive experience at the Cosy Cadet and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: okemovacation
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 and we enjoyed our stay in Paris for four days at Cosy's. Hotel staff was very accommodating to all our needs. Great sized room for family of 4. Great location in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are big for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CJDCJD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as hubby had business meetings and were very happy with Cosy's. It wasnt cheap and we probably wouldn't have stayed here if work hadn't been paying, but I'm very glad we did! For Paris, the room was big! We werent expecting big as we had stayed in cramped little rooms before in Paris, so this was a pleasant surprise. Room was clean and modern, the bathroom and kitchen clean and tidy. The window was large and opened right up so the room was light and cool. NB: The elevator is very small, you may have to do multiple trips with one bag per trip! In terms of location, Rue Cadet is small and crowded.. then again, the whole L'Opera 'area' seems to be crowded and small.. I would not recommend driving there. Our taxi wouldnt even go down the street, we were dropped at the closest intersection. One thing I found really hard was all the smoking in that area. I guess that's just Paris for you, but having a 5 month old with me was really hard as everyone was smoking in the street and the cafe's, especially around Rue Cadet. I tried to sit inside away from the smell (as it is harmful for babies) but people smoked in the doorways and it blew in anyway. Having said that, Cosy's is a pleasant surprise as you go through a small door and wander into a large courtyard that is spacious and out of the hustle and bustle - and the smoke! One complaint we have about Cosy's is the internet. It worked the first few hours we were there, then 'went down' and we didnt have it again for the remainder of our stay. Apparantly it was a problem with the whole street...?? In the end, to have internet, we had to pay for some 'Orange' time as the signal was available in that area. Finally, I would say that unless its included in your rate, dont pay for the breakfast. It is a very limited breakfast for an expensive price. There are cafe's at the end of Rue Cadet that are better. All in all, I'd stay here again! The light, spacious and air-y room won me over, even with the cost, and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely No Service - only good until something goes wrong”
Reviews.Author: Audreynherboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2011. Upon arrival, parking almost impossible because so so tight. Room was OK size but kitchen dishes and utensils were dirty...clearly not professionally cleaned between hotel guests. Safe was broken and staff confirmed that it had been left that way after a couple locked there Passports in and had to leave quickly. They also said there was no way to have it fixed during our stay. Also, shower ran out hot water quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Your own studio apartment in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: galloping_grannie
Reviews.Content: This was a last-minute booking as previous accomodation plans fell through and I was delighted to have my own large studio in this characterful area of Paris (9me). Well laid-out (roomy studio, adjacent kitchen with sink, fridge, hob and microwave, separate proper bathroom - not a cupboard with a shower - and toilet. Although the usual Paris hotel in a converted 19c building, has great charm, sometimes the conveniences of a late 20c purpose-built apartment hotel outweigh the period features. The hotel overlooks a courtyard which is absolutely quiet once the door to the street is closed at midnight, although there was a very small amount of noise early in the morning as the cafes and shops in the street get to work. I was pleased to have a top-floor apartment and certainly wasn't bothered by noise from neighbours (see previous reviews) although I did take their advice and took slippers so as not to annoy those below me. There are charming reception staff who show you to your room and greet you as you pass through the lobby, but if you are looking for bowing flunkeys, bell hops, baggage carriers, waiters and room service this is not the place for you. The street is a delight and reminds one how much our high streets have lost in England - a butcher, 2 or 3 greengrocers, a marvellous ironmongers, 3 baker/pastry shops, 2 bookshops, a chemist, a general store and numerous cafes and small restaurants. Bustling with life all day and all evening. La mere du famille (the most picturesque sweet shop in Paris)on the corner and Bouillon Chartier (go at mid-day when all of the Parisian workers go for a quick lunch, not in the evening when it is full of tourists) just down the road. Explore the covered arcades at the end of the road and try a meal in Passage des Panoramas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly large room in an atmospheric part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: SS_Aussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with 1 double and 2 single beds. It was great for us-our party consisted of myself and my husband, his mother and her sister. The suite had a kitchenette which was sparsely but adequately supplied with cooking utensils. The only down side was that there was only 1 bathroom, though the toilet and shower were separate, which helped. Staff were friendly and helpful. OUr safe was broken so we were allowed to store valuables in the hotel safe. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel dining area-we bought ours own supplies from the local street vendors, which was yum. Well recommended for a reasonably priced stay in a much larger than normal room in a convenient part of Paris. We will stay again when with a group of more then 2.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly and the location-fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: Bossquito
Reviews.Content: We booked Cosy's Cadet as part of a package deal with Eurostar on-line from Australia. It wasn't cheap but we wanted a comfy stay with our 9 and 10 year old kids- we were not disappointed. The location is fantastic; we were blessed with fine weather so we walked to and from the hotel straight down Rue Lafayette from Gare du Nord in about 20 minutes....suitcases and kids included. Rue Cadet is a lovely little Parisienne thoroughfare with lots of delicious food options and accessible to the Right Bank, Montmartre and Boulevarde Haussman department stores by foot if you're adventurous. Metro very handy if you're not. Our room itself was very spacious, excellently well equipped kitchen, nice sitting area and a lovely bathroom with it's own hot water tank....blissful showers and long hot soaks. We would only list one fault- the slate floors are incredibly noisy. We had a young family above us (we knew because their toddlers were running and jumping without restraint from 0530 am) with no carpet to muffle their very busy little feet. The following night their successors in this room arrived home at 0230 am and decided it was time to change their furniture arrangement! Again,this was incredibly noisy on a tiled floor that again, our whole family was woken. Other than this we enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much and found front of house staff very friendly and helpful. We will book again if we are lucky enough to return to beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in a bustling area”
Reviews.Author: Les05MiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: The best part of Paris that we have found so far. Everywhere central is walkable but metro and buses are great. The restaurants and deli's in Cadet are excellent suiting all tastes and wallets. This Appartment-hotel is "cosy" yet the rooms are large, not cheap at nearly Â£180 per night but well appointed with separate toilet, separate bathoom and small kitchen with separate dining area. At 15 minutes walk from Gare du Nord it is the first city break where we had no need of taxis. We had breakfast in the local deli's at half the cost of the hotel and the local bars never seemed to close. Great time. The only negative in the whole trip was the food on the Eurostar, everything so cold as to be almost frozen, except the white wine which was warm. Can we have a collective whinge to get Eurostar to think again?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: YSie
Reviews.Content: Went there by car, took 3times round the block driving, before found the entrance. The Hotel is located in a small alley, and very bad marked. Receptionist was very helpful and friendly. Explain everything from public transport to places to see, and the best time to visit touristical places. Room are very spacious for paris standard ( we took the suite with 2 bedrooms ) Room was clean, and refreshments in the fridge is free of charge, also coffee maker + condiments are free. Air con seems centrally controlled, since we could not adjust it. but since te temp is around 10'C we dont really missed it. All in all we are very pleased with this residence, very helpful staffs. TIP : Since we left the car in the hotel ( basement parking, eur 25,-/day ), we took the metro for travelling around, ALWAYS keep your metro ticket with you !! on our last night we went to Champs Ellysee for last night cafÃ© visit, and went back to the hotel, on the exit of our metro station ( = Metro Cadet, 5 min walk from the hotel ), there were ticket control by Paris Metro, and my wife had thrown away her ticket, since she thought we will never need it again.....:( the fine was Eur 40,- !! they do not have any understanding at all, whatever story you tell, even the rest of us still have our ticket, except my wife. the officers were very rude and arrogant !!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AckofromPacco
Reviews.Content: Experience is as Trip Advisor contributors describe. The apartment hotel concept works perfectly for an 8 night stay. Great quality food and wine are available in the street if you get tired of going out. Any number of excellent restaraunts within easy walking. Great bar a few doors up for a couple of frothies in the afternoon.Good size rooms. Only issue is the floors. They are cold and noisy. Take some slippers.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value for money stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Zorpas
Reviews.Content: I've spent quite some time trying to find a hotel in Paris that was a good value for money, was close to Paris center and was good enough to stay with two young children (5 and 1 year old). Cose Cadet was the one. The room was huge compared to Paris standards; it had a king size bed, an extra bed for the five year old and an extra cot for the 1 year old. And there was plenty of room to move around, even with our stroller. The room was very clean, it had all amenities of an apartment such as plates and cutlery, water boiler (a must with a baby), coffee maker, over, cooker, fridge and even an LCD screen (I believe it was a 32" in size). The location was 15 minutes walk to the Opera and the Metro station was 3 minutes away. The service was amazing; all the people there were very friendly and always willing to help with anything we needed. The area has everything one would need; from shops, to bakeries, to restaurants, to bars. It is very quite and safe as well. Breakfast was not a buffet, but the few things that they had (croisants, coffee, milk, juice, yogurts, bread, various jams) were perfect and fresh. We us a family of 4 did not need anything else till lunch time. And it had free WiFi in the rooms. And all this for 700 Euros for 5 nights!! What else would anyone want? When we go back to Paris again in a few years time, I won't even bother looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for family in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mikekSingapore
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Cosy's. Our family loves apartment/suite style places over traditional hotel. Positive highlights: - kitchenette, dining room, living room - location on wonderful side street that is very quiet - helpful staff - easy to get transportation (as is most of central Europe) Few items to consider: - rooms did not have doors, so parents don't get complete privacy - breakfast (optional) was good but can easily obtain wonderful food nearby - minimal daily maid service - not next to major attractions (we consider this a positive)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment/hotel - superb staff, quality fittings, very clean and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: chchester
Reviews.Content: Would certainly stay here again ourselves and highly recommend! Good Points â€¢ Very helpful & friendly staff who could speak good English. Many thanks to Anna-Rose and Elena particularly for their help, advice and overall excellent customer service! â€¢ Double rooms are very spacious and include a dining table and chairs along with a 2 seater settee, coffee table, desk unit and good quality flat screen TV. â€¢ Double bed that is very comfortable (albeit 2 singles pushed together as is standard in Europe) with a firm bed mattress and quality bedding. â€¢ Modern, tiled and clean bathroom with shower over bath but superb shower pressure. â€¢ Separate modern tiled toilet. â€¢ Plenty of white good quality towels. â€¢ Set back in a Courtyard so no road noise which is a problem with other hotels in Paris. â€¢ 10 min walk to the La Fayette, Printemps and the non-stop Roissy bus for Charles De Gaulle airport from Place De Lâ€™Opera. â€¢ Ideally placed for shopping along Blvd Haussmann, Rue La Fayette and eating out along Blvd Des Italiens. â€¢ Area around the hotel is safe and quiet with Cadet metro station a 3 minute walk away. â€¢ A number of excellent traditional French restaurants are within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. â€¢ Hotelâ€™s local street has everything you may need if you wish to use hotel on a self catering basis - numerous traditional French grocers, butchers and amazing patisseries (watch those calories as you will be spoilt for choice)! â€¢ Air conditioning and heating is very effective with each bedroom having its own settings. â€¢ Standard continental breakfast including cereal (no choice), croissants, bread/jams, orange juice & water, choice of yoghurts, freshly made tea/coffee and fresh fruit. Bad points â€¢ As mentioned on other feedback all room floors are tiled resulting in a certain amount of noise from guests in the room above; particularly when any furniture is moved e.g. dining chairs and when someone walks across the floor in hard heeled shoes. However, tiled floor gives an overall modern look to the room and keeps it cool in hot weather. â€¢ Shower is integral with the bath which may be unsuitable for anyone with a disability.

Reviews.Title: “came back again to Cozy, and better than before!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTigger1
Reviews.Content: it was very nice to come back to cozy's residence this summer with my sister's family. they remembered us and told us that they improved the noise problem. in fact they carpeted in the hall which prevent much noise. i did not have any problems of noise at all. they also change to wireless internet connection. the things I like about this hotel is very friendly and welcoming us. all staffs are very helpful and trying to do their best all the time. only the downside of the hotel was that they put the price up this year and also the amenities (shampoo/soap/etc) used to be the ones from Loccitene, but this year was non-brand one. but these are minor things. also the other customers were mostly family with small children or decent people so that we did not hear any noise at night.(e.g young group of people having parties or something) all slept very well. close to gare du nord and opera.

Reviews.Title: “A real family friendly place to stay with excellent service & location”
Reviews.Author: ArdeeIrelandPauliano
Reviews.Content: The appartment was very well equipped and very spacious for us and our two young children and included a hugh wardrobe , Ironing facilities, Kitchen with fridge, kettle, cooker & microwave. The appartment included a Bathroom with separate toilet which was cleaned and restocked daily or as requested. There was a Safe located in the appartment were you could store all your valuables with peace of mind. The staff were very helpfull and could speak very good english if your french was not very good. We stayed for seven nights and every one offered a good nights sleep....Yes you could hear a few noises from the appartment above but all in all every one enjoyed a good night sleep. The only thing that some people may find a problem with is that the bedroom areas were both open plan offering little privacy from anyone in the sitting area, but after hours of walking around, looking at the sights, there was no diffuculties getting the kids to sleep. The place itself was in an excellent location and offered easy access for both Metro and RER links to the ususal sights and Disneyland. infact, it only took 40-45 minutes to get to Disneyland by Metro & train with no difficulties. Walking around the area offered loads of places to sit and eat ( and drink) and if you were brave enough to cycle around the city, the city-bikes were located just a minute away from the appartment. The appartments were in a secure off street complex with secure doors at the street that would close in late evening till morning with residents only able to gain access. The best thing is that you could get out of the appartment in the morning, nip across the road to the patisserie and bring back your delicious croissants, bread or indeed delicious eclaires that one can only experience in france. A supermarket was located 1 minute away so you could maintain your supplies of coffee & Tea and fresh milk. I would definately recommend these appartments to any family wanting to enjoy a great experience in Paris. Well done COSY'S!! we had an excellent time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Daisymae19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel 12 July. Room was an apartment and very spacious. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Getting to the hotel sounded daunting from other reviews but in the end was quite straightforward. Arriving at CDG terminal 2A walk quite a distance to follow signs for the RER B. Go to the ticket office and ask for a ticket to get to Metro Cadet. Take train to the Garde du Nord then metro to Garde L'est take metro line 4 then metro line 7. Ticket cost 17 euro 40 return. To use the metro buy a carnet de 10 tickets and this costs 12 euro this did 2 people for 3 days. Took an open top bus to see the sights but did not go to the Eiffel Tower as it was a 2 hour queue. Went to the Moulin Rouge for show and dinner. It cost 300 euros. The dinner was not worth it but the show was. You can do show and champagne for 102 euro which would have been great but it was fully booked. Word of warning 14 July is Bastille Day fantastic parade and fireworks but a lot of places close for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: oceanroad4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for a week and we loved the apartment it was clean and spacious. Down side was the niose factor from upstairs as we could hear every footstep of the tenants above us and for some reason they sounded like they were moving furniture 24/7! So if we stayed again we would make sure we were on the top floor. It's well located and the food stores that line the street are fantastic...highly recommended but get above the noise. Oh and they need new pillows.. the ones they have are as flat as pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious apartment, but where were the staff?”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of Feb and I can't fault the apartment: it was spacious, spotlessly clean, great location, king size bed, but the staff, or lack of, really let this place down! There was one person on reception when we checked in and I felt a bit sorry for him because he was there all day alone, he was there the next morning and when we ordered room service breakfast he also brought it up for us himself on a tiny plastic tray which couldn't hold everything, so he had to come up three times with all the breakfast on it. They advertise room service, but it wasn't remotely organised, as he seemed to have no idea what he was doing or what to bring up to us. He told us we had to make our own tea as he couldn't bring that up, he didn't bring any milk and we had to ask him to bring up the fruit and yogurt twice before he did. About 5 or more other times during our stay we went down to reception and no one was was there at all! One time we waited almost 20 minutes for a member of staff to arrive at reception and when he did, he arrived with a big box of take-away, he had gone out to get himself some dinner whilst on duty, which he then proceeded to eat at reception! We didn't see any management there at all during our 3 night stay, no one seemed to be available to talk to about this and there was never more than one person on reception at a time. On many occasions we could not find any staff at all! For a 4 star establishment, or any kind of hotel or apartment this is simply unacceptable. I'm not sure if they had staffing problems this particular weekend or if it is always like this, the staff offered no apologies for being absent. It really let the place down and it meant we had to do a lot of unnecessary waiting around, which was a pain for us when we were only there for a weekend. Overall the apartment was lovely, but they need to get some more staff and if they are going to offer room service this needs to be properly organised rather than getting the staff member on reception to bring it up by himself, leaving reception unattended in so doing. I would stay again if they sorted the staffing problems out, because otherwise we had a great time, the location is peaceful and central for getting around all the sightseeing spots in Paris and the apartment was fantastic and had pretty much everything you would need for a long weekend. It's just a shame they didn't hire a few more staff otherwise I would have rated this top for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in good area - felt like our own apartment!”
Reviews.Author: kaffeee
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place in Paris. The street it's in is lovely & quiet with food shops down one end, so you can get fresh supplies. 10 minute wak to the Opera area, 10 mins on tube from top of street to the Louvre. The rooms are well equipped with their own kitchen, dining table, sofa and coffee table. The bed is massive! Take adequate supplies of tea & coffee with you as you only get one lot of coffee & mint tea in the welcome pack. The staff are very welcoming, friendly and speak excellent english. The hairdryer is one of those automatic nozzle things, so yours with you if you don't want to stand drying your hair forever (it did the job though!). As others have said, because of the tiles, you do hear the people in other rooms walking about, but it wasn't a problem and I'm very sensitive to noise. Don't know what the breakfast is like, as we had croissants in our room or ate out, but from what I could see it looked OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice hotel....BUT !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MFC_GCFC_YCCC
Reviews.Content: First Impressions - Very impressed. Good location 20 minutes on foot to the Louvre, 200 metres from Cadet Metro station. BAD POINTS...My wife's mobile was stolen from the room the hotel did nothing to resolve the situation or compensate us. The floors are paper thin, make sure you stay on the fifth floor otherwise expect some noise from above. Book your own taxi back to the airport, the hotel mini van cost 20 euro more than a normal cab. It is a real shame that I have negative comments about our experience. In general it is a good hotel. I guess we were VERY unlucky?

Reviews.Title: “A place worthy of a return visit”
Reviews.Author: Kairune
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Cosy's after reading the really good reviews. And we are happy to report that the previous reviews were very accurate. We got a train from the airport to Gare Du Nord station and trundled down the streets of paris and found the Rui Cadet street just off the main Lafayette street. Rui Cadet is a lovely market street with many interesting shops to visit. Directly opposite is a new freemasons museum. The apartment was spacious and modern with everthing you may need. Breakfast was simple but nice. The hotel staff especially the manageress Anne-Rose were extremely helpful and pleasant which made us feel very welcome. The location of the hotel was superb it was very central to all the places we wanted to visit which we did by foot to take in the sights. Montmartre (Moulin Rouge, SacreCeour and artists quarter) were about 20 minutes walk north, Arc de Triomphe 30mins west, Louvre 15 mins south, Notre Dam 20 mins south, Latin Quarter & St Germain De-Pres 30 mins south. If you did want to take the metro which was easy to use there is a station just at the top of the street on Lafayette. The only downside of the apartment was that you could hear noise from the apartment above due to the tiled floors. It didn't bother us too much but thought I had best point it out. There was no noise from the street as the apartments are set back from the main street. I would definately recommend this hotel and we will book here again next time we visit Paris. Bon Voyage.

Reviews.Title: “The Way to Go in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroESQ
Reviews.Content: This apartment hotel lived up to my expectations. It is well located and the price is reasonable. It is just the right size for a family of five and very close to the Metro and food shops. Do not expect full hotel services. The cleaning staff only makes up the rooms and the bathroom/toilet. It does not clean the kitchen. The kitchen is well equipped, ideal for breakfast and quick snacks or reheating. The staff is helpful and the size is good. Perhaps the bedrooms could use a door or another way to make them a bit more private.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, utilitarian reception area, great location if you like that sort of thing”
Reviews.Author: Hard_to_pleaseUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights (a Friday and a Sunday) and got the same room both times. I could see what other reviewers meant about noise from other rooms, though it wasn't a particular problem during my stay. My rooms was spacious and nicely tricked out, living up to the photographs on the hotel's website. Reception was friendly and relaxed (both rare qualities in Paris hotels!), although the reception area felt a bit tatty and something of an afterthought. The location was part of my reason for choosing this hotel -- but for the perhaps somewhat odd reason that I used to live just around the corner. However, it is central enough with good access to the Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est and to the Grands Magasins department stores. By day this is a bustling market street, at night it is quiet, but on the fringes of a couple of livelier areas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay...”
Reviews.Author: NickPefki
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean room in a really cozy hotel. Located on a very quiet street having the metro station only 2 minutes on foot. Many shops nearby to please any of your needs (restaurants, cafes, supermarket, groceries, bakeries etc.). Best of all: its staff was extremely polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent October Vacation in hotel with everything your need”
Reviews.Author: kich
Reviews.Content: A plesant October saw my wife and myself presented with a trip to Paris for Arc weekend which also coincided with Fashion week. Busy as it was the accomodation booked by our son lived up to all the excellent reviews. We were greeted on arrival by the most helpful receptiona rea staff and were shown to our spacious room. This contained all the comforts of home and even some cookies, tea and coffee awaiting us. Each morning the towels etc were changed and the room left spotless and fresh again. The location of Cosy's Cadet is so convenient, 500 meters from the Metro and good quality restaurants and shops. All the employees we met during our stay were most helpful, any information we requested was provided with so much attention. They recommended different areas to visit and the best transport via metro, bus or taxi to get us where we wanted to go. All this was done with wonderful individual attention despite how busy the residence was during our few days there. My wife and myself will have no hesitation in revisiting Cosy's Cadet residence and we can only highly recommend this very comfortable, convenient and friendly residence to any visitor to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best by many parameters”
Reviews.Author: alexr0
Reviews.Content: 1) Ideal location: by feet to Opera, one can by feet to railway to the airport; 90m from metro. At the same time: it is a quiet street, lot of different small "Parisian" food shops, 3 restaurants and also a "Subway" (all feed stations are opened till midnight). Oh, and this street is for pedestrians! Oh, and Monmartre is literally the next street around the corner! And, finally, it is NOT a tourist area, so no noise! Absolutely phenomenal. 2) HUGE rooms. I can't imagine something like this in "normal" European hotels, not saying about Paris. 3) Very experienced and helpful staff. Not only trained, but really experienced. Our case was an unexpected return flight delay till late night hours. Since we are a family we were granted by late check-out for free, so we continued discovering Paris through that day and could have a rest in evening. Reception assistant took on herself all inquiries (in French!) with flight company till the situation becomes absolutely clear. We were offered the optimal transfer option for late evening hours (please note, we travelled with a kid). 4) Breakfast exists, yet it is modest. Baguett, honey, cereals, milk, coffee, orange juice -all fresh and tasty. This menu is fixed forever and served every morning. We enjoyed it, but if you start a day with ham and cheese, you'd better book without breakfast. 5) There is a quitchenette in the room! Dishes, forks, etc, including even a corkscrew. Conclusion: for toursts in Paris (especially for families) - really fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, I have found the way to stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: ethanmParis
Reviews.Content: Cosy's has all the elements of the perfect hotel - large rooms (very unusual for Paris), good wireless, great air-conditioning (unusual for Paris), location (near metro, lots of restaurants, stores outside hotel door), and great staff service, We stayed on the top floor, so didn't hear any noise mentioned in other reviews. Apartment comes with fully equipped kitchen, utensils, pots and pans, stove top, fridge and microwave. Bought some groceries from local stores, and every morning walked accros the street to the bakery to pick up fresh croissants and baguettes. Street also has a few nice vegetable stores which is very convenient. 3 supermarkets just around the corner. Great way to save money on meals, especially in this very expensive eating town. Smaller room is very adequate for couple and additional child. Highly recommended! Only negative - no safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: Jadar99
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Cosy's by coincidence, after leaving another property. We arrived around 10am, expecting to drop off luggage in a room but were very happy to be allowed into our rooms. We stayed in a Large Suite, and it lived up to its name. What I liked about the property was: Quiet rooms - being set back from the street meant not being woken up by traffic, trucks, late night revellers etc. King size bed - made it really feel like a holiday Separate toilet to bathroom - for more privacy in the morning Good quality fittings in the bathroom, so it all felt indulgent L'Occitane products - yum! Cooking facilities with enough kitchen items to actually allow cooking, not just snacking. Wardrobe, so luggage and clothes could be stored properly Dining table Lounge area with good size flat panel TV I was also very happy with the service at the hotel. No matter who was on the front desk, we were always welcomed, day or night. Reception also helped with little requests, like using their computer for some quick internet banking. They couldn't do enough, and totally disspelled any myths about Parisians not being helpful. For the price per night (EUR170) even if it's 10-20% more than you would normally expect to pay, it is well worth it, for the location, facilities and service. Rue Cadet is a great little street within walking distance to Cadet Metro. It's filled with local food produce - bakeries, grocers, delicatessen etc so you can enjoy fresh pastries in your room in the morning if you want. Even the people in those shops would greet us in the street at the end of a week there! All-in-all, I would stay there again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaHongKong
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Good location and very close to metro. Very helpful staff and good service. Big room with fully equipped kitchen and a dinning area. If you feel like cooking with fresh ingredients, it is convenient to have the kitchen. Clean and comfortable room and bed. There are a lot of restaurants and small supermarkets to buy drinks and fruits nearby the hotel. They also provide free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel great staff (by A.P ISRAEL)”
Reviews.Author: avital65
Reviews.Content: Fully equiped kitchen, big room, comfortable location near Metro station, wonderful helpful staff, very quiet (not on the street). Rue CADET is a small but full of life street, where you can find any kind of food u like. Me and my wife had a wonderfull stay there that w'll remember for a long time. The staff was exeptionally helpull and patience. Highly recommended. Liked â€” evrything.. Disliked â€” some minor problem with A.C. that was solved.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean room, good location!”
Reviews.Author: daphnebubbles
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this excellent hotel to anybody visiting Paris. Although the 9th is not a particularly salubrious area, Rue Cadet has two great patisseries, supermarket, two tabacs and some nice restaurants very close by. With friendly and helpful staff, the room was huge - featuring a double and two single beds, sitting area, dining area, bathroom and well-equipped kitchen. Reasonably priced for a group of girls I would highly recommend this hotel - in fact I'm missing it already!

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Cosy's Cadet
HotelInfo.Address: 7, rue Cadet, 75009 Paris, France
